info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 18 at 11:33PM CDT until August 19 at 10:15AM CDT by NWS Chicago IL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring.
* WHERE...A portion of northwest Indiana, including the following counties, Lake IN and Porter.
* WHEN...Until 1015 AM CDT Tuesday.
* IMPACTS...Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Low-lying areas such as fields and ditches may be flooded.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1130 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicate that between 1 and 3 inches of rain has fallen earlier this evening. Incoming showers and thunderstorms may cause an additional inch of rain to fell in the next few hours. The combined effects of previous and incoming rainfall may cause flooding to continue into Tuesday morning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Gary, Portage, Merrillville, Valparaiso, Schererville, Hobart, Highland, Munster, Chesterton, Griffith, Dyer, Lake Station, Lynwood, South Haven, Porter, New Chicago, Burns Harbor, Ogden Dunes, Town of Pines and Beverly Shores. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 AM CDT TUESDAY
